Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 2)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json import time from ddgs import DDGS print('=== SEARCHING FOR LUCAS ALAMÁN MEXICAN RURAL HISTORY ARTICLE TITLE ===') print('Objective: Find the specific title of Lucas Alamán\'s article about Mexican rural history') print('Context: Lucas Alamán was confirmed as the historian with both conservative modernization biographies and Mexican rural history works') print() # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Initialize search results storage search_results = { 'timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'objective': 'Find specific title of Lucas Alamán article on Mexican rural history', 'historian_confirmed': 'Lucas Alamán', 'search_queries': [], 'all_findings': [], 'potential_titles': [], 'analysis_summary': {} } print('TARGET CHARACTERISTICS:') print('• Author: Lucas Alamán') print('• Topic: Mexican rural history (not general Mexican history)') print('• Format: Article (not full book like Historia de México)') print('• Focus: Specifically rural/agricultural aspects of Mexican history') print() # Search Strategy 1: Direct search for Lucas Alamán rural history articles print('=== SEARCH STRATEGY 1: LUCAS ALAMÁN RURAL HISTORY ARTICLES ===') print('=' * 70) queries_strategy1 = [ 'Lucas Alamán Mexican rural history article title', '"Lucas Alamán" rural Mexico agriculture history article', 'Lucas Alamán countryside Mexican history work title', '"Lucas Alamán" rural agricultural Mexico historical article' ] searcher = DDGS(timeout=15) for i, query in enumerate(queries_strategy1, 1): print(f'\nSearch {i}: {query}') try: results = searcher.text( query, max_results=10, page=1, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "bing", "yandex"], safesearch="off", region="en-us" ) if results == []: print(f'No results found for: {query}') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'direct_rural_search', 'results_count': 0, 'status': 'no_results' }) else: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'direct_rural_search', 'results_count': len(results), 'status': 'success' }) # Analyze each result for relevant titles for j, result in enumerate(results, 1): title = result.get('title', '') url = result.get('href', '') snippet = result.get('body', '') print(f'\n Result {j}:') print(f' Title: {title}') print(f' URL: {url}') print(f' Snippet: {snippet[:200]}...' if len(snippet) > 200 else f' Snippet: {snippet}') # Check for relevance indicators combined_text = f'{title} {snippet}'.lower() relevance_indicators = [] # Key terms for rural history rural_terms = ['rural', 'countryside', 'agricultural', 'farming', 'hacienda', 'land', 'peasant'] alamán_terms = ['lucas alamán', 'alamán'] article_terms = ['article', 'essay', 'work', 'study', 'paper'] for term in rural_terms: if term in combined_text: relevance_indicators.append(f'rural:{term}') for term in alamán_terms: if term in combined_text: relevance_indicators.append(f'author:{term}') for term in article_terms: if term in combined_text: relevance_indicators.append(f'format:{term}') if relevance_indicators: print(f' ⭐ RELEVANCE INDICATORS: {", ".join(relevance_indicators)}') # Look for potential article titles in quotes or italics import re title_patterns = [ r'"([^"]*rural[^"]*?)"', r'"([^"]*countryside[^"]*?)"', r'"([^"]*agricultural[^"]*?)"', r'titled "([^"]+)"', r'article "([^"]+)"', r'work "([^"]+)"' ] potential_titles_found = [] for pattern in title_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, combined_text, re.IGNORECASE) potential_titles_found.extend(matches) if potential_titles_found: print(f' 📚 POTENTIAL TITLES FOUND: {potential_titles_found}') for title_candidate in potential_titles_found: search_results['potential_titles'].append({ 'title': title_candidate, 'source_url': url, 'source_title': title, 'context_snippet': snippet[:300], 'relevance_indicators': relevance_indicators, 'search_query': query, 'confidence': 'medium' }) # Store all relevant findings search_results['all_findings'].append({ 'search_query': query, 'result_title': title, 'result_url': url, 'result_snippet': snippet, 'relevance_indicators': relevance_indicators, 'potential_titles': potential_titles_found, 'strategy': 'direct_rural_search' }) else: print(f' No relevant indicators found') time.sleep(2) # Rate limiting except Exception as e: print(f'Error in search {i}: {str(e)}') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'direct_rural_search', 'results_count': 0, 'status': f'error: {str(e)}' }) print('\n' + '=' * 70) print('SEARCH STRATEGY 2: LUCAS ALAMÁN BIBLIOGRAPHY AND WORKS') print('=' * 70) # Search Strategy 2: Look for comprehensive bibliographies of Lucas Alamán queries_strategy2 = [ '"Lucas Alamán" bibliography complete works list', 'Lucas Alamán articles essays rural Mexico bibliography', '"Lucas Alamán" historical works rural agricultural writings', 'Lucas Alamán obra completa rural historia Mexico' ] for i, query in enumerate(queries_strategy2, 1): print(f'\nBibliography Search {i}: {query}') try: results = searcher.text( query, max_results=8, page=1, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "bing"], safesearch="off", region="en-us" ) if results == []: print(f'No results found for: {query}') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'bibliography_search', 'results_count': 0, 'status': 'no_results' }) else: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'bibliography_search', 'results_count': len(results), 'status': 'success' }) # Look for bibliographic information for j, result in enumerate(results, 1): title = result.get('title', '') url = result.get('href', '') snippet = result.get('body', '') print(f'\n Bibliography Result {j}:') print(f' Title: {title}') print(f' URL: {url}') print(f' Snippet: {snippet[:250]}...' if len(snippet) > 250 else f' Snippet: {snippet}') # Look for lists of works or bibliographic entries combined_text = f'{title} {snippet}'.lower() bibliography_indicators = [] if 'bibliography' in combined_text: bibliography_indicators.append('bibliography') if 'works' in combined_text: bibliography_indicators.append('works') if 'writings' in combined_text: bibliography_indicators.append('writings') if 'articles' in combined_text: bibliography_indicators.append('articles') if 'essays' in combined_text: bibliography_indicators.append('essays') if 'rural' in combined_text: bibliography_indicators.append('rural') if bibliography_indicators: print(f' 📖 BIBLIOGRAPHY INDICATORS: {", ".join(bibliography_indicators)}') # Look for specific work titles mentioned import re work_patterns = [ r'"([^"]*[Rr]ural[^"]*?)"', r'"([^"]*[Aa]gricult[^"]*?)"', r'"([^"]*[Cc]ountryside[^"]*?)"', r'"([^"]*[Hh]acienda[^"]*?)"', r'[Tt]itled[:\s]+"([^"]+)"', r'[Aa]rticle[:\s]+"([^"]+)"' ] bibliography_titles = [] for pattern in work_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, snippet, re.IGNORECASE) bibliography_titles.extend(matches) if bibliography_titles: print(f' 📚 WORKS MENTIONED: {bibliography_titles}') for work_title in bibliography_titles: search_results['potential_titles'].append({ 'title': work_title, 'source_url': url, 'source_title': title, 'context_snippet': snippet[:300], 'relevance_indicators': bibliography_indicators, 'search_query': query, 'confidence': 'high', 'source_type': 'bibliography' }) search_results['all_findings'].append({ 'search_query': query, 'result_title': title, 'result_url': url, 'result_snippet': snippet, 'relevance_indicators': bibliography_indicators, 'potential_titles': bibliography_titles, 'strategy': 'bibliography_search' }) time.sleep(2) # Rate limiting except Exception as e: print(f'Error in bibliography search {i}: {str(e)}') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'bibliography_search', 'results_count': 0, 'status': f'error: {str(e)}' }) print('\n' + '=' * 70) print('SEARCH STRATEGY 3: ACADEMIC SOURCES AND CITATIONS') print('=' * 70) # Search Strategy 3: Look in academic sources that might cite his rural history work queries_strategy3 = [ 'Lucas Alamán rural history cited academic sources', '"Lucas Alamán" Mexican agricultural history scholarly articles', 'Lucas Alamán hacienda system historical analysis', 'site:jstor.org "Lucas Alamán" rural Mexico' ] for i, query in enumerate(queries_strategy3, 1): print(f'\nAcademic Search {i}: {query}') try: results = searcher.text( query, max_results=6, page=1, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "bing"], safesearch="off", region="en-us" ) if results == []: print(f'No results found for: {query}') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'academic_search', 'results_count': 0, 'status': 'no_results' }) else: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'academic_search', 'results_count': len(results), 'status': 'success' }) # Analyze academic sources for j, result in enumerate(results, 1): title = result.get('title', '') url = result.get('href', '') snippet = result.get('body', '') print(f'\n Academic Result {j}:') print(f' Title: {title}') print(f' URL: {url}') print(f' Snippet: {snippet[:250]}...' if len(snippet) > 250 else f' Snippet: {snippet}') # Check for academic credibility indicators combined_text = f'{title} {snippet}'.lower() academic_indicators = [] if 'jstor' in url.lower(): academic_indicators.append('jstor') if 'academia.edu' in url.lower(): academic_indicators.append('academia') if 'university' in combined_text: academic_indicators.append('university') if 'journal' in combined_text: academic_indicators.append('journal') if 'cited' in combined_text: academic_indicators.append('cited') if 'references' in combined_text: academic_indicators.append('references') if academic_indicators or 'lucas alamán' in combined_text: print(f' 🎓 ACADEMIC INDICATORS: {", ".join(academic_indicators)}') # Look for citations or references to specific works - FIXED REGEX PATTERNS import re citation_patterns = [ r'Alamán[,\s]+["\']([^"\']*)rural([^"\']*)["\'']', r'["\']([^"\']*)rural([^"\']*)["\''][,\s]*Alamán', r'Alamán[,\s]+["\']([^"\']*)agricult([^"\']*)["\'']', r'["\']([^"\']*)agricult([^"\']*)["\''][,\s]*Alamán' ] citation_titles = [] for pattern in citation_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, snippet, re.IGNORECASE) for match in matches: if isinstance(match, tuple): citation_titles.append(' '.join(match).strip()) else: citation_titles.append(match.strip()) if citation_titles: print(f' 📝 CITATIONS FOUND: {citation_titles}') for citation in citation_titles: search_results['potential_titles'].append({ 'title': citation, 'source_url': url, 'source_title': title, 'context_snippet': snippet[:300], 'relevance_indicators': academic_indicators, 'search_query': query, 'confidence': 'high', 'source_type': 'academic_citation' }) search_results['all_findings'].append({ 'search_query': query, 'result_title': title, 'result_url': url, 'result_snippet': snippet, 'relevance_indicators': academic_indicators, 'potential_titles': citation_titles, 'strategy': 'academic_search' }) time.sleep(3) # Longer delay for academic searches except Exception as e: print(f'Error in academic search {i}: {str(e)}') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'academic_search', 'results_count': 0, 'status': f'error: {str(e)}' }) # Save comprehensive search results results_file = os.path.join('workspace', 'lucas_alaman_rural_history_search.json') with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(search_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH RESULTS ANALYSIS') print('=' * 80) total_queries = len(search_results['search_queries']) successful_queries = len([q for q in search_results['search_queries'] if q['status'] == 'success']) total_findings = len(search_results['all_findings']) total_potential_titles = len(search_results['potential_titles']) print(f'\n📊 SEARCH STATISTICS:') print(f' • Total queries executed: {total_queries}') print(f' • Successful queries: {successful_queries}') print(f' • Total findings collected: {total_findings}') print(f' • Potential titles identified: {total_potential_titles}') print(f'\n🔍 SEARCH RESULTS SAVED TO: {results_file}') if search_results['potential_titles']: print(f'\n📚 POTENTIAL ARTICLE TITLES FOUND:') print('=' * 50) # Group by confidence level high_confidence = [t for t in search_results['potential_titles'] if t['confidence'] == 'high'] medium_confidence = [t for t in search_results['potential_titles'] if t['confidence'] == 'medium'] if high_confidence: print(f'\n🎯 HIGH CONFIDENCE TITLES ({len(high_confidence)}):') for i, title_info in enumerate(high_confidence, 1): print(f'\n{i}. "{title_info["title"]}"') print(f' Source: {title_info["source_title"]}') print(f' URL: {title_info["source_url"]}') print(f' Type: {title_info.get("source_type", "general")}') print(f' Context: {title_info["context_snippet"][:150]}...') if medium_confidence: print(f'\n📋 MEDIUM CONFIDENCE TITLES ({len(medium_confidence)}):') for i, title_info in enumerate(medium_confidence, 1): print(f'\n{i}. "{title_info["title"]}"') print(f' Source: {title_info["source_title"]}') print(f' Context: {title_info["context_snippet"][:100]}...') # Create summary of most promising titles print(f'\n🏆 MOST PROMISING CANDIDATES:') print('=' * 40) # Prioritize academic sources and high confidence academic_titles = [t for t in search_results['potential_titles'] if t.get('source_type') == 'academic_citation'] bibliography_titles = [t for t in search_results['potential_titles'] if t.get('source_type') == 'bibliography'] if academic_titles: print('\n📖 From Academic Citations:') for title_info in academic_titles[:3]: # Top 3 print(f' • "{title_info["title"]}"') if bibliography_titles: print('\n📚 From Bibliographies:') for title_info in bibliography_titles[:3]: # Top 3 print(f' • "{title_info["title"]}"') # Final analysis summary search_results['analysis_summary'] = { 'total_queries': total_queries, 'successful_queries': successful_queries, 'total_findings': total_findings, 'potential_titles_count': total_potential_titles, 'high_confidence_titles': len(high_confidence), 'medium_confidence_titles': len(medium_confidence), 'academic_source_titles': len(academic_titles), 'bibliography_source_titles': len(bibliography_titles), 'search_strategies_used': ['direct_rural_search', 'bibliography_search', 'academic_search'] } else: print('\n❌ NO POTENTIAL TITLES IDENTIFIED') print('This suggests either:') print('1. The specific rural history article title is very obscure') print('2. It may be part of a larger work rather than standalone') print('3. Different search terms or approaches may be needed') print('4. The work may be known by a different description') # Save updated results with analysis with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(search_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n💾 UPDATED RESULTS SAVED TO: {results_file}') print('\n🎯 NEXT STEPS:') print('1. Review all potential titles for the most specific rural history focus') print('2. Cross-reference findings with known Lucas Alamán bibliographies') print('3. Investigate high-confidence academic citations') print('4. Consider searching for the work in Spanish if needed') print('\n=== LUCAS ALAMÁN RURAL HISTORY ARTICLE SEARCH COMPLETED ===')
Execution Output

Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - SyntaxError: unterminated string literal at line 356. The code has a critical syntax error in the regex pattern definition within the citation_patterns list where string quotes are not properly escaped or terminated. The error occurs specifically in the academic search section where complex regex patterns attempt to match citations containing both single and double quotes, causing Python to misinterpret the string boundaries. **PLAN** alignment: 0% - no search execution completed due to syntax error preventing the script from running. The overall code structure appears well-designed with comprehensive three-strategy search approach (direct rural search, bibliography search, academic citations), but the regex pattern syntax issue blocks all functionality. Recommended fix: Examine the citation_patterns list around line 356 and fix the string literal escaping - either use raw strings with proper quote escaping or switch to triple quotes for complex patterns containing mixed quote types.
Python Code python
import os import json import time from ddgs import DDGS print('=== SEARCHING FOR LUCAS ALAMÁN MEXICAN RURAL HISTORY ARTICLE TITLE ===') print('Objective: Find the specific title of Lucas Alamán\'s article about Mexican rural history') print('Context: Lucas Alamán was confirmed as the historian with both conservative modernization biographies and Mexican rural history works') print() # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Initialize search results storage search_results = { 'timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'objective': 'Find specific title of Lucas Alamán article on Mexican rural history', 'historian_confirmed': 'Lucas Alamán', 'search_queries': [], 'all_findings': [], 'potential_titles': [], 'analysis_summary': {} } print('TARGET CHARACTERISTICS:') print('• Author: Lucas Alamán') print('• Topic: Mexican rural history (not general Mexican history)') print('• Format: Article (not full book like Historia de México)') print('• Focus: Specifically rural/agricultural aspects of Mexican history') print() # Search Strategy 1: Direct search for Lucas Alamán rural history articles print('=== SEARCH STRATEGY 1: LUCAS ALAMÁN RURAL HISTORY ARTICLES ===') print('=' * 70) queries_strategy1 = [ 'Lucas Alamán Mexican rural history article title', '"Lucas Alamán" rural Mexico agriculture history article', 'Lucas Alamán countryside Mexican history work title', '"Lucas Alamán" rural agricultural Mexico historical article' ] searcher = DDGS(timeout=15) for i, query in enumerate(queries_strategy1, 1): print(f'\nSearch {i}: {query}') try: results = searcher.text( query, max_results=10, page=1, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "bing", "yandex"], safesearch="off", region="en-us" ) if results == []: print(f'No results found for: {query}') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'direct_rural_search', 'results_count': 0, 'status': 'no_results' }) else: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'direct_rural_search', 'results_count': len(results), 'status': 'success' }) # Analyze each result for relevant titles for j, result in enumerate(results, 1): title = result.get('title', '') url = result.get('href', '') snippet = result.get('body', '') print(f'\n Result {j}:') print(f' Title: {title}') print(f' URL: {url}') print(f' Snippet: {snippet[:200]}...' if len(snippet) > 200 else f' Snippet: {snippet}') # Check for relevance indicators combined_text = f'{title} {snippet}'.lower() relevance_indicators = [] # Key terms for rural history rural_terms = ['rural', 'countryside', 'agricultural', 'farming', 'hacienda', 'land', 'peasant'] alamán_terms = ['lucas alamán', 'alamán'] article_terms = ['article', 'essay', 'work', 'study', 'paper'] for term in rural_terms: if term in combined_text: relevance_indicators.append(f'rural:{term}') for term in alamán_terms: if term in combined_text: relevance_indicators.append(f'author:{term}') for term in article_terms: if term in combined_text: relevance_indicators.append(f'format:{term}') if relevance_indicators: print(f' ⭐ RELEVANCE INDICATORS: {", ".join(relevance_indicators)}') # Look for potential article titles in quotes or italics import re title_patterns = [ r'"([^"]*rural[^"]*?)"', r'"([^"]*countryside[^"]*?)"', r'"([^"]*agricultural[^"]*?)"', r'titled "([^"]+)"', r'article "([^"]+)"', r'work "([^"]+)"' ] potential_titles_found = [] for pattern in title_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, combined_text, re.IGNORECASE) potential_titles_found.extend(matches) if potential_titles_found: print(f' 📚 POTENTIAL TITLES FOUND: {potential_titles_found}') for title_candidate in potential_titles_found: search_results['potential_titles'].append({ 'title': title_candidate, 'source_url': url, 'source_title': title, 'context_snippet': snippet[:300], 'relevance_indicators': relevance_indicators, 'search_query': query, 'confidence': 'medium' }) # Store all relevant findings search_results['all_findings'].append({ 'search_query': query, 'result_title': title, 'result_url': url, 'result_snippet': snippet, 'relevance_indicators': relevance_indicators, 'potential_titles': potential_titles_found, 'strategy': 'direct_rural_search' }) else: print(f' No relevant indicators found') time.sleep(2) # Rate limiting except Exception as e: print(f'Error in search {i}: {str(e)}') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'direct_rural_search', 'results_count': 0, 'status': f'error: {str(e)}' }) print('\n' + '=' * 70) print('SEARCH STRATEGY 2: LUCAS ALAMÁN BIBLIOGRAPHY AND WORKS') print('=' * 70) # Search Strategy 2: Look for comprehensive bibliographies of Lucas Alamán queries_strategy2 = [ '"Lucas Alamán" bibliography complete works list', 'Lucas Alamán articles essays rural Mexico bibliography', '"Lucas Alamán" historical works rural agricultural writings', 'Lucas Alamán obra completa rural historia Mexico' ] for i, query in enumerate(queries_strategy2, 1): print(f'\nBibliography Search {i}: {query}') try: results = searcher.text( query, max_results=8, page=1, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "bing"], safesearch="off", region="en-us" ) if results == []: print(f'No results found for: {query}') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'bibliography_search', 'results_count': 0, 'status': 'no_results' }) else: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'bibliography_search', 'results_count': len(results), 'status': 'success' }) # Look for bibliographic information for j, result in enumerate(results, 1): title = result.get('title', '') url = result.get('href', '') snippet = result.get('body', '') print(f'\n Bibliography Result {j}:') print(f' Title: {title}') print(f' URL: {url}') print(f' Snippet: {snippet[:250]}...' if len(snippet) > 250 else f' Snippet: {snippet}') # Look for lists of works or bibliographic entries combined_text = f'{title} {snippet}'.lower() bibliography_indicators = [] if 'bibliography' in combined_text: bibliography_indicators.append('bibliography') if 'works' in combined_text: bibliography_indicators.append('works') if 'writings' in combined_text: bibliography_indicators.append('writings') if 'articles' in combined_text: bibliography_indicators.append('articles') if 'essays' in combined_text: bibliography_indicators.append('essays') if 'rural' in combined_text: bibliography_indicators.append('rural') if bibliography_indicators: print(f' 📖 BIBLIOGRAPHY INDICATORS: {", ".join(bibliography_indicators)}') # Look for specific work titles mentioned import re work_patterns = [ r'"([^"]*[Rr]ural[^"]*?)"', r'"([^"]*[Aa]gricult[^"]*?)"', r'"([^"]*[Cc]ountryside[^"]*?)"', r'"([^"]*[Hh]acienda[^"]*?)"', r'[Tt]itled[:\s]+"([^"]+)"', r'[Aa]rticle[:\s]+"([^"]+)"' ] bibliography_titles = [] for pattern in work_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, snippet, re.IGNORECASE) bibliography_titles.extend(matches) if bibliography_titles: print(f' 📚 WORKS MENTIONED: {bibliography_titles}') for work_title in bibliography_titles: search_results['potential_titles'].append({ 'title': work_title, 'source_url': url, 'source_title': title, 'context_snippet': snippet[:300], 'relevance_indicators': bibliography_indicators, 'search_query': query, 'confidence': 'high', 'source_type': 'bibliography' }) search_results['all_findings'].append({ 'search_query': query, 'result_title': title, 'result_url': url, 'result_snippet': snippet, 'relevance_indicators': bibliography_indicators, 'potential_titles': bibliography_titles, 'strategy': 'bibliography_search' }) time.sleep(2) # Rate limiting except Exception as e: print(f'Error in bibliography search {i}: {str(e)}') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'bibliography_search', 'results_count': 0, 'status': f'error: {str(e)}' }) print('\n' + '=' * 70) print('SEARCH STRATEGY 3: ACADEMIC SOURCES AND CITATIONS') print('=' * 70) # Search Strategy 3: Look in academic sources that might cite his rural history work queries_strategy3 = [ 'Lucas Alamán rural history cited academic sources', '"Lucas Alamán" Mexican agricultural history scholarly articles', 'Lucas Alamán hacienda system historical analysis', 'site:jstor.org "Lucas Alamán" rural Mexico' ] for i, query in enumerate(queries_strategy3, 1): print(f'\nAcademic Search {i}: {query}') try: results = searcher.text( query, max_results=6, page=1, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "bing"], safesearch="off", region="en-us" ) if results == []: print(f'No results found for: {query}') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'academic_search', 'results_count': 0, 'status': 'no_results' }) else: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'academic_search', 'results_count': len(results), 'status': 'success' }) # Analyze academic sources for j, result in enumerate(results, 1): title = result.get('title', '') url = result.get('href', '') snippet = result.get('body', '') print(f'\n Academic Result {j}:') print(f' Title: {title}') print(f' URL: {url}') print(f' Snippet: {snippet[:250]}...' if len(snippet) > 250 else f' Snippet: {snippet}') # Check for academic credibility indicators combined_text = f'{title} {snippet}'.lower() academic_indicators = [] if 'jstor' in url.lower(): academic_indicators.append('jstor') if 'academia.edu' in url.lower(): academic_indicators.append('academia') if 'university' in combined_text: academic_indicators.append('university') if 'journal' in combined_text: academic_indicators.append('journal') if 'cited' in combined_text: academic_indicators.append('cited') if 'references' in combined_text: academic_indicators.append('references') if academic_indicators or 'lucas alamán' in combined_text: print(f' 🎓 ACADEMIC INDICATORS: {", ".join(academic_indicators)}') # Look for citations or references to specific works - FIXED REGEX PATTERNS import re citation_patterns = [ r'Alamán[,\s]+["\']([^"\']*)rural([^"\']*)["\'']', r'["\']([^"\']*)rural([^"\']*)["\''][,\s]*Alamán', r'Alamán[,\s]+["\']([^"\']*)agricult([^"\']*)["\'']', r'["\']([^"\']*)agricult([^"\']*)["\''][,\s]*Alamán' ] citation_titles = [] for pattern in citation_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, snippet, re.IGNORECASE) for match in matches: if isinstance(match, tuple): citation_titles.append(' '.join(match).strip()) else: citation_titles.append(match.strip()) if citation_titles: print(f' 📝 CITATIONS FOUND: {citation_titles}') for citation in citation_titles: search_results['potential_titles'].append({ 'title': citation, 'source_url': url, 'source_title': title, 'context_snippet': snippet[:300], 'relevance_indicators': academic_indicators, 'search_query': query, 'confidence': 'high', 'source_type': 'academic_citation' }) search_results['all_findings'].append({ 'search_query': query, 'result_title': title, 'result_url': url, 'result_snippet': snippet, 'relevance_indicators': academic_indicators, 'potential_titles': citation_titles, 'strategy': 'academic_search' }) time.sleep(3) # Longer delay for academic searches except Exception as e: print(f'Error in academic search {i}: {str(e)}') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'academic_search', 'results_count': 0, 'status': f'error: {str(e)}' }) # Save comprehensive search results results_file = os.path.join('workspace', 'lucas_alaman_rural_history_search.json') with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(search_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH RESULTS ANALYSIS') print('=' * 80) total_queries = len(search_results['search_queries']) successful_queries = len([q for q in search_results['search_queries'] if q['status'] == 'success']) total_findings = len(search_results['all_findings']) total_potential_titles = len(search_results['potential_titles']) print(f'\n📊 SEARCH STATISTICS:') print(f' • Total queries executed: {total_queries}') print(f' • Successful queries: {successful_queries}') print(f' • Total findings collected: {total_findings}') print(f' • Potential titles identified: {total_potential_titles}') print(f'\n🔍 SEARCH RESULTS SAVED TO: {results_file}') if search_results['potential_titles']: print(f'\n📚 POTENTIAL ARTICLE TITLES FOUND:') print('=' * 50) # Group by confidence level high_confidence = [t for t in search_results['potential_titles'] if t['confidence'] == 'high'] medium_confidence = [t for t in search_results['potential_titles'] if t['confidence'] == 'medium'] if high_confidence: print(f'\n🎯 HIGH CONFIDENCE TITLES ({len(high_confidence)}):') for i, title_info in enumerate(high_confidence, 1): print(f'\n{i}. "{title_info["title"]}"') print(f' Source: {title_info["source_title"]}') print(f' URL: {title_info["source_url"]}') print(f' Type: {title_info.get("source_type", "general")}') print(f' Context: {title_info["context_snippet"][:150]}...') if medium_confidence: print(f'\n📋 MEDIUM CONFIDENCE TITLES ({len(medium_confidence)}):') for i, title_info in enumerate(medium_confidence, 1): print(f'\n{i}. "{title_info["title"]}"') print(f' Source: {title_info["source_title"]}') print(f' Context: {title_info["context_snippet"][:100]}...') # Create summary of most promising titles print(f'\n🏆 MOST PROMISING CANDIDATES:') print('=' * 40) # Prioritize academic sources and high confidence academic_titles = [t for t in search_results['potential_titles'] if t.get('source_type') == 'academic_citation'] bibliography_titles = [t for t in search_results['potential_titles'] if t.get('source_type') == 'bibliography'] if academic_titles: print('\n📖 From Academic Citations:') for title_info in academic_titles[:3]: # Top 3 print(f' • "{title_info["title"]}"') if bibliography_titles: print('\n📚 From Bibliographies:') for title_info in bibliography_titles[:3]: # Top 3 print(f' • "{title_info["title"]}"') # Final analysis summary search_results['analysis_summary'] = { 'total_queries': total_queries, 'successful_queries': successful_queries, 'total_findings': total_findings, 'potential_titles_count': total_potential_titles, 'high_confidence_titles': len(high_confidence), 'medium_confidence_titles': len(medium_confidence), 'academic_source_titles': len(academic_titles), 'bibliography_source_titles': len(bibliography_titles), 'search_strategies_used': ['direct_rural_search', 'bibliography_search', 'academic_search'] } else: print('\n❌ NO POTENTIAL TITLES IDENTIFIED') print('This suggests either:') print('1. The specific rural history article title is very obscure') print('2. It may be part of a larger work rather than standalone') print('3. Different search terms or approaches may be needed') print('4. The work may be known by a different description') # Save updated results with analysis with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(search_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n💾 UPDATED RESULTS SAVED TO: {results_file}') print('\n🎯 NEXT STEPS:') print('1. Review all potential titles for the most specific rural history focus') print('2. Cross-reference findings with known Lucas Alamán bibliographies') print('3. Investigate high-confidence academic citations') print('4. Consider searching for the work in Spanish if needed') print('\n=== LUCAS ALAMÁN RURAL HISTORY ARTICLE SEARCH COMPLETED ===')

developer
2025-08-09 14:15:55
Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 3)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json import time from ddgs import DDGS print('=== SEARCHING FOR LUCAS ALAMÁN MEXICAN RURAL HISTORY ARTICLE TITLE ===') print('Objective: Find the specific title of Lucas Alamán\'s article about Mexican rural history') print('Context: Lucas Alamán was confirmed as the historian with both conservative modernization biographies and Mexican rural history works') print() # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Initialize search results storage search_results = { 'timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'objective': 'Find specific title of Lucas Alamán article on Mexican rural history', 'historian_confirmed': 'Lucas Alamán', 'search_queries': [], 'all_findings': [], 'potential_titles': [], 'analysis_summary': {} } print('TARGET CHARACTERISTICS:') print('• Author: Lucas Alamán') print('• Topic: Mexican rural history (not general Mexican history)') print('• Format: Article (not full book like Historia de México)') print('• Focus: Specifically rural/agricultural aspects of Mexican history') print() # Search Strategy 1: Direct search for Lucas Alamán rural history articles print('=== SEARCH STRATEGY 1: LUCAS ALAMÁN RURAL HISTORY ARTICLES ===') print('=' * 70) queries_strategy1 = [ 'Lucas Alamán Mexican rural history article title', '"Lucas Alamán" rural Mexico agriculture history article', 'Lucas Alamán countryside Mexican history work title', '"Lucas Alamán" rural agricultural Mexico historical article' ] searcher = DDGS(timeout=15) for i, query in enumerate(queries_strategy1, 1): print(f'\nSearch {i}: {query}') try: results = searcher.text( query, max_results=10, page=1, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "bing", "yandex"], safesearch="off", region="en-us" ) if results == []: print(f'No results found for: {query}') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'direct_rural_search', 'results_count': 0, 'status': 'no_results' }) else: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'direct_rural_search', 'results_count': len(results), 'status': 'success' }) # Analyze each result for relevant titles for j, result in enumerate(results, 1): title = result.get('title', '') url = result.get('href', '') snippet = result.get('body', '') print(f'\n Result {j}:') print(f' Title: {title}') print(f' URL: {url}') print(f' Snippet: {snippet[:200]}...' if len(snippet) > 200 else f' Snippet: {snippet}') # Check for relevance indicators combined_text = f'{title} {snippet}'.lower() relevance_indicators = [] # Key terms for rural history rural_terms = ['rural', 'countryside', 'agricultural', 'farming', 'hacienda', 'land', 'peasant'] alamán_terms = ['lucas alamán', 'alamán'] article_terms = ['article', 'essay', 'work', 'study', 'paper'] for term in rural_terms: if term in combined_text: relevance_indicators.append(f'rural:{term}') for term in alamán_terms: if term in combined_text: relevance_indicators.append(f'author:{term}') for term in article_terms: if term in combined_text: relevance_indicators.append(f'format:{term}') if relevance_indicators: print(f' ⭐ RELEVANCE INDICATORS: {", ".join(relevance_indicators)}') # Look for potential article titles in quotes or italics import re title_patterns = [ r'"([^"]*rural[^"]*?)"', r'"([^"]*countryside[^"]*?)"', r'"([^"]*agricultural[^"]*?)"', r'titled "([^"]+)"', r'article "([^"]+)"', r'work "([^"]+)"' ] potential_titles_found = [] for pattern in title_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, combined_text, re.IGNORECASE) potential_titles_found.extend(matches) if potential_titles_found: print(f' 📚 POTENTIAL TITLES FOUND: {potential_titles_found}') for title_candidate in potential_titles_found: search_results['potential_titles'].append({ 'title': title_candidate, 'source_url': url, 'source_title': title, 'context_snippet': snippet[:300], 'relevance_indicators': relevance_indicators, 'search_query': query, 'confidence': 'medium' }) # Store all relevant findings search_results['all_findings'].append({ 'search_query': query, 'result_title': title, 'result_url': url, 'result_snippet': snippet, 'relevance_indicators': relevance_indicators, 'potential_titles': potential_titles_found, 'strategy': 'direct_rural_search' }) else: print(f' No relevant indicators found') time.sleep(2) # Rate limiting except Exception as e: print(f'Error in search {i}: {str(e)}') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'direct_rural_search', 'results_count': 0, 'status': f'error: {str(e)}' }) print('\n' + '=' * 70) print('SEARCH STRATEGY 2: LUCAS ALAMÁN BIBLIOGRAPHY AND WORKS') print('=' * 70) # Search Strategy 2: Look for comprehensive bibliographies of Lucas Alamán queries_strategy2 = [ '"Lucas Alamán" bibliography complete works list', 'Lucas Alamán articles essays rural Mexico bibliography', '"Lucas Alamán" historical works rural agricultural writings', 'Lucas Alamán obra completa rural historia Mexico' ] for i, query in enumerate(queries_strategy2, 1): print(f'\nBibliography Search {i}: {query}') try: results = searcher.text( query, max_results=8, page=1, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "bing"], safesearch="off", region="en-us" ) if results == []: print(f'No results found for: {query}') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'bibliography_search', 'results_count': 0, 'status': 'no_results' }) else: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'bibliography_search', 'results_count': len(results), 'status': 'success' }) # Look for bibliographic information for j, result in enumerate(results, 1): title = result.get('title', '') url = result.get('href', '') snippet = result.get('body', '') print(f'\n Bibliography Result {j}:') print(f' Title: {title}') print(f' URL: {url}') print(f' Snippet: {snippet[:250]}...' if len(snippet) > 250 else f' Snippet: {snippet}') # Look for lists of works or bibliographic entries combined_text = f'{title} {snippet}'.lower() bibliography_indicators = [] if 'bibliography' in combined_text: bibliography_indicators.append('bibliography') if 'works' in combined_text: bibliography_indicators.append('works') if 'writings' in combined_text: bibliography_indicators.append('writings') if 'articles' in combined_text: bibliography_indicators.append('articles') if 'essays' in combined_text: bibliography_indicators.append('essays') if 'rural' in combined_text: bibliography_indicators.append('rural') if bibliography_indicators: print(f' 📖 BIBLIOGRAPHY INDICATORS: {", ".join(bibliography_indicators)}') # Look for specific work titles mentioned import re work_patterns = [ r'"([^"]*[Rr]ural[^"]*?)"', r'"([^"]*[Aa]gricult[^"]*?)"', r'"([^"]*[Cc]ountryside[^"]*?)"', r'"([^"]*[Hh]acienda[^"]*?)"', r'[Tt]itled[:\s]+"([^"]+)"', r'[Aa]rticle[:\s]+"([^"]+)"' ] bibliography_titles = [] for pattern in work_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, snippet, re.IGNORECASE) bibliography_titles.extend(matches) if bibliography_titles: print(f' 📚 WORKS MENTIONED: {bibliography_titles}') for work_title in bibliography_titles: search_results['potential_titles'].append({ 'title': work_title, 'source_url': url, 'source_title': title, 'context_snippet': snippet[:300], 'relevance_indicators': bibliography_indicators, 'search_query': query, 'confidence': 'high', 'source_type': 'bibliography' }) search_results['all_findings'].append({ 'search_query': query, 'result_title': title, 'result_url': url, 'result_snippet': snippet, 'relevance_indicators': bibliography_indicators, 'potential_titles': bibliography_titles, 'strategy': 'bibliography_search' }) time.sleep(2) # Rate limiting except Exception as e: print(f'Error in bibliography search {i}: {str(e)}') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'bibliography_search', 'results_count': 0, 'status': f'error: {str(e)}' }) print('\n' + '=' * 70) print('SEARCH STRATEGY 3: ACADEMIC SOURCES AND CITATIONS') print('=' * 70) # Search Strategy 3: Look in academic sources that might cite his rural history work queries_strategy3 = [ 'Lucas Alamán rural history cited academic sources', '"Lucas Alamán" Mexican agricultural history scholarly articles', 'Lucas Alamán hacienda system historical analysis', 'site:jstor.org "Lucas Alamán" rural Mexico' ] for i, query in enumerate(queries_strategy3, 1): print(f'\nAcademic Search {i}: {query}') try: results = searcher.text( query, max_results=6, page=1, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "bing"], safesearch="off", region="en-us" ) if results == []: print(f'No results found for: {query}') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'academic_search', 'results_count': 0, 'status': 'no_results' }) else: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'academic_search', 'results_count': len(results), 'status': 'success' }) # Analyze academic sources for j, result in enumerate(results, 1): title = result.get('title', '') url = result.get('href', '') snippet = result.get('body', '') print(f'\n Academic Result {j}:') print(f' Title: {title}') print(f' URL: {url}') print(f' Snippet: {snippet[:250]}...' if len(snippet) > 250 else f' Snippet: {snippet}') # Check for academic credibility indicators combined_text = f'{title} {snippet}'.lower() academic_indicators = [] if 'jstor' in url.lower(): academic_indicators.append('jstor') if 'academia.edu' in url.lower(): academic_indicators.append('academia') if 'university' in combined_text: academic_indicators.append('university') if 'journal' in combined_text: academic_indicators.append('journal') if 'cited' in combined_text: academic_indicators.append('cited') if 'references' in combined_text: academic_indicators.append('references') if academic_indicators or 'lucas alamán' in combined_text: print(f' 🎓 ACADEMIC INDICATORS: {", ".join(academic_indicators)}') # Look for citations or references to specific works - SIMPLIFIED APPROACH import re # Use simpler patterns to avoid quote escaping issues simple_citation_patterns = [ r'"([^"]+rural[^"]+)"', # Anything with 'rural' in quotes r'"([^"]+agricult[^"]+)"', # Anything with 'agricult' in quotes r'"([^"]+countryside[^"]+)"', # Anything with 'countryside' in quotes r'"([^"]+hacienda[^"]+)"' # Anything with 'hacienda' in quotes ] citation_titles = [] for pattern in simple_citation_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, snippet, re.IGNORECASE) citation_titles.extend(matches) if citation_titles: print(f' 📝 CITATIONS FOUND: {citation_titles}') for citation in citation_titles: search_results['potential_titles'].append({ 'title': citation, 'source_url': url, 'source_title': title, 'context_snippet': snippet[:300], 'relevance_indicators': academic_indicators, 'search_query': query, 'confidence': 'high', 'source_type': 'academic_citation' }) search_results['all_findings'].append({ 'search_query': query, 'result_title': title, 'result_url': url, 'result_snippet': snippet, 'relevance_indicators': academic_indicators, 'potential_titles': citation_titles, 'strategy': 'academic_search' }) time.sleep(3) # Longer delay for academic searches except Exception as e: print(f'Error in academic search {i}: {str(e)}') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'academic_search', 'results_count': 0, 'status': f'error: {str(e)}' }) # Save comprehensive search results results_file = os.path.join('workspace', 'lucas_alaman_rural_history_search.json') with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(search_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH RESULTS ANALYSIS') print('=' * 80) total_queries = len(search_results['search_queries']) successful_queries = len([q for q in search_results['search_queries'] if q['status'] == 'success']) total_findings = len(search_results['all_findings']) total_potential_titles = len(search_results['potential_titles']) print(f'\n📊 SEARCH STATISTICS:') print(f' • Total queries executed: {total_queries}') print(f' • Successful queries: {successful_queries}') print(f' • Total findings collected: {total_findings}') print(f' • Potential titles identified: {total_potential_titles}') print(f'\n🔍 SEARCH RESULTS SAVED TO: {results_file}') if search_results['potential_titles']: print(f'\n📚 POTENTIAL ARTICLE TITLES FOUND:') print('=' * 50) # Group by confidence level high_confidence = [t for t in search_results['potential_titles'] if t['confidence'] == 'high'] medium_confidence = [t for t in search_results['potential_titles'] if t['confidence'] == 'medium'] if high_confidence: print(f'\n🎯 HIGH CONFIDENCE TITLES ({len(high_confidence)}):') for i, title_info in enumerate(high_confidence, 1): print(f'\n{i}. "{title_info["title"]}"') print(f' Source: {title_info["source_title"]}') print(f' URL: {title_info["source_url"]}') print(f' Type: {title_info.get("source_type", "general")}') print(f' Context: {title_info["context_snippet"][:150]}...') if medium_confidence: print(f'\n📋 MEDIUM CONFIDENCE TITLES ({len(medium_confidence)}):') for i, title_info in enumerate(medium_confidence, 1): print(f'\n{i}. "{title_info["title"]}"') print(f' Source: {title_info["source_title"]}') print(f' Context: {title_info["context_snippet"][:100]}...') # Create summary of most promising titles print(f'\n🏆 MOST PROMISING CANDIDATES:') print('=' * 40) # Prioritize academic sources and high confidence academic_titles = [t for t in search_results['potential_titles'] if t.get('source_type') == 'academic_citation'] bibliography_titles = [t for t in search_results['potential_titles'] if t.get('source_type') == 'bibliography'] if academic_titles: print('\n📖 From Academic Citations:') for title_info in academic_titles[:3]: # Top 3 print(f' • "{title_info["title"]}"') if bibliography_titles: print('\n📚 From Bibliographies:') for title_info in bibliography_titles[:3]: # Top 3 print(f' • "{title_info["title"]}"') # Final analysis summary search_results['analysis_summary'] = { 'total_queries': total_queries, 'successful_queries': successful_queries, 'total_findings': total_findings, 'potential_titles_count': total_potential_titles, 'high_confidence_titles': len(high_confidence), 'medium_confidence_titles': len(medium_confidence), 'academic_source_titles': len(academic_titles), 'bibliography_source_titles': len(bibliography_titles), 'search_strategies_used': ['direct_rural_search', 'bibliography_search', 'academic_search'] } else: print('\n❌ NO POTENTIAL TITLES IDENTIFIED') print('This suggests either:') print('1. The specific rural history article title is very obscure') print('2. It may be part of a larger work rather than standalone') print('3. Different search terms or approaches may be needed') print('4. The work may be known by a different description') # Save updated results with analysis with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(search_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n💾 UPDATED RESULTS SAVED TO: {results_file}') print('\n🎯 NEXT STEPS:') print('1. Review all potential titles for the most specific rural history focus') print('2. Cross-reference findings with known Lucas Alamán bibliographies') print('3. Investigate high-confidence academic citations') print('4. Consider searching for the work in Spanish if needed') print('\n=== LUCAS ALAMÁN RURAL HISTORY ARTICLE SEARCH COMPLETED ===')

Python Code python
import os import json import time from ddgs import DDGS print('=== SEARCHING FOR LUCAS ALAMÁN MEXICAN RURAL HISTORY ARTICLE TITLE ===') print('Objective: Find the specific title of Lucas Alamán\'s article about Mexican rural history') print('Context: Lucas Alamán was confirmed as the historian with both conservative modernization biographies and Mexican rural history works') print() # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Initialize search results storage search_results = { 'timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'objective': 'Find specific title of Lucas Alamán article on Mexican rural history', 'historian_confirmed': 'Lucas Alamán', 'search_queries': [], 'all_findings': [], 'potential_titles': [], 'analysis_summary': {} } print('TARGET CHARACTERISTICS:') print('• Author: Lucas Alamán') print('• Topic: Mexican rural history (not general Mexican history)') print('• Format: Article (not full book like Historia de México)') print('• Focus: Specifically rural/agricultural aspects of Mexican history') print() # Search Strategy 1: Direct search for Lucas Alamán rural history articles print('=== SEARCH STRATEGY 1: LUCAS ALAMÁN RURAL HISTORY ARTICLES ===') print('=' * 70) queries_strategy1 = [ 'Lucas Alamán Mexican rural history article title', '"Lucas Alamán" rural Mexico agriculture history article', 'Lucas Alamán countryside Mexican history work title', '"Lucas Alamán" rural agricultural Mexico historical article' ] searcher = DDGS(timeout=15) for i, query in enumerate(queries_strategy1, 1): print(f'\nSearch {i}: {query}') try: results = searcher.text( query, max_results=10, page=1, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "bing", "yandex"], safesearch="off", region="en-us" ) if results == []: print(f'No results found for: {query}') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'direct_rural_search', 'results_count': 0, 'status': 'no_results' }) else: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'direct_rural_search', 'results_count': len(results), 'status': 'success' }) # Analyze each result for relevant titles for j, result in enumerate(results, 1): title = result.get('title', '') url = result.get('href', '') snippet = result.get('body', '') print(f'\n Result {j}:') print(f' Title: {title}') print(f' URL: {url}') print(f' Snippet: {snippet[:200]}...' if len(snippet) > 200 else f' Snippet: {snippet}') # Check for relevance indicators combined_text = f'{title} {snippet}'.lower() relevance_indicators = [] # Key terms for rural history rural_terms = ['rural', 'countryside', 'agricultural', 'farming', 'hacienda', 'land', 'peasant'] alamán_terms = ['lucas alamán', 'alamán'] article_terms = ['article', 'essay', 'work', 'study', 'paper'] for term in rural_terms: if term in combined_text: relevance_indicators.append(f'rural:{term}') for term in alamán_terms: if term in combined_text: relevance_indicators.append(f'author:{term}') for term in article_terms: if term in combined_text: relevance_indicators.append(f'format:{term}') if relevance_indicators: print(f' ⭐ RELEVANCE INDICATORS: {", ".join(relevance_indicators)}') # Look for potential article titles in quotes or italics import re title_patterns = [ r'"([^"]*rural[^"]*?)"', r'"([^"]*countryside[^"]*?)"', r'"([^"]*agricultural[^"]*?)"', r'titled "([^"]+)"', r'article "([^"]+)"', r'work "([^"]+)"' ] potential_titles_found = [] for pattern in title_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, combined_text, re.IGNORECASE) potential_titles_found.extend(matches) if potential_titles_found: print(f' 📚 POTENTIAL TITLES FOUND: {potential_titles_found}') for title_candidate in potential_titles_found: search_results['potential_titles'].append({ 'title': title_candidate, 'source_url': url, 'source_title': title, 'context_snippet': snippet[:300], 'relevance_indicators': relevance_indicators, 'search_query': query, 'confidence': 'medium' }) # Store all relevant findings search_results['all_findings'].append({ 'search_query': query, 'result_title': title, 'result_url': url, 'result_snippet': snippet, 'relevance_indicators': relevance_indicators, 'potential_titles': potential_titles_found, 'strategy': 'direct_rural_search' }) else: print(f' No relevant indicators found') time.sleep(2) # Rate limiting except Exception as e: print(f'Error in search {i}: {str(e)}') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'direct_rural_search', 'results_count': 0, 'status': f'error: {str(e)}' }) print('\n' + '=' * 70) print('SEARCH STRATEGY 2: LUCAS ALAMÁN BIBLIOGRAPHY AND WORKS') print('=' * 70) # Search Strategy 2: Look for comprehensive bibliographies of Lucas Alamán queries_strategy2 = [ '"Lucas Alamán" bibliography complete works list', 'Lucas Alamán articles essays rural Mexico bibliography', '"Lucas Alamán" historical works rural agricultural writings', 'Lucas Alamán obra completa rural historia Mexico' ] for i, query in enumerate(queries_strategy2, 1): print(f'\nBibliography Search {i}: {query}') try: results = searcher.text( query, max_results=8, page=1, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "bing"], safesearch="off", region="en-us" ) if results == []: print(f'No results found for: {query}') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'bibliography_search', 'results_count': 0, 'status': 'no_results' }) else: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'bibliography_search', 'results_count': len(results), 'status': 'success' }) # Look for bibliographic information for j, result in enumerate(results, 1): title = result.get('title', '') url = result.get('href', '') snippet = result.get('body', '') print(f'\n Bibliography Result {j}:') print(f' Title: {title}') print(f' URL: {url}') print(f' Snippet: {snippet[:250]}...' if len(snippet) > 250 else f' Snippet: {snippet}') # Look for lists of works or bibliographic entries combined_text = f'{title} {snippet}'.lower() bibliography_indicators = [] if 'bibliography' in combined_text: bibliography_indicators.append('bibliography') if 'works' in combined_text: bibliography_indicators.append('works') if 'writings' in combined_text: bibliography_indicators.append('writings') if 'articles' in combined_text: bibliography_indicators.append('articles') if 'essays' in combined_text: bibliography_indicators.append('essays') if 'rural' in combined_text: bibliography_indicators.append('rural') if bibliography_indicators: print(f' 📖 BIBLIOGRAPHY INDICATORS: {", ".join(bibliography_indicators)}') # Look for specific work titles mentioned import re work_patterns = [ r'"([^"]*[Rr]ural[^"]*?)"', r'"([^"]*[Aa]gricult[^"]*?)"', r'"([^"]*[Cc]ountryside[^"]*?)"', r'"([^"]*[Hh]acienda[^"]*?)"', r'[Tt]itled[:\s]+"([^"]+)"', r'[Aa]rticle[:\s]+"([^"]+)"' ] bibliography_titles = [] for pattern in work_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, snippet, re.IGNORECASE) bibliography_titles.extend(matches) if bibliography_titles: print(f' 📚 WORKS MENTIONED: {bibliography_titles}') for work_title in bibliography_titles: search_results['potential_titles'].append({ 'title': work_title, 'source_url': url, 'source_title': title, 'context_snippet': snippet[:300], 'relevance_indicators': bibliography_indicators, 'search_query': query, 'confidence': 'high', 'source_type': 'bibliography' }) search_results['all_findings'].append({ 'search_query': query, 'result_title': title, 'result_url': url, 'result_snippet': snippet, 'relevance_indicators': bibliography_indicators, 'potential_titles': bibliography_titles, 'strategy': 'bibliography_search' }) time.sleep(2) # Rate limiting except Exception as e: print(f'Error in bibliography search {i}: {str(e)}') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'bibliography_search', 'results_count': 0, 'status': f'error: {str(e)}' }) print('\n' + '=' * 70) print('SEARCH STRATEGY 3: ACADEMIC SOURCES AND CITATIONS') print('=' * 70) # Search Strategy 3: Look in academic sources that might cite his rural history work queries_strategy3 = [ 'Lucas Alamán rural history cited academic sources', '"Lucas Alamán" Mexican agricultural history scholarly articles', 'Lucas Alamán hacienda system historical analysis', 'site:jstor.org "Lucas Alamán" rural Mexico' ] for i, query in enumerate(queries_strategy3, 1): print(f'\nAcademic Search {i}: {query}') try: results = searcher.text( query, max_results=6, page=1, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "bing"], safesearch="off", region="en-us" ) if results == []: print(f'No results found for: {query}') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'academic_search', 'results_count': 0, 'status': 'no_results' }) else: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'academic_search', 'results_count': len(results), 'status': 'success' }) # Analyze academic sources for j, result in enumerate(results, 1): title = result.get('title', '') url = result.get('href', '') snippet = result.get('body', '') print(f'\n Academic Result {j}:') print(f' Title: {title}') print(f' URL: {url}') print(f' Snippet: {snippet[:250]}...' if len(snippet) > 250 else f' Snippet: {snippet}') # Check for academic credibility indicators combined_text = f'{title} {snippet}'.lower() academic_indicators = [] if 'jstor' in url.lower(): academic_indicators.append('jstor') if 'academia.edu' in url.lower(): academic_indicators.append('academia') if 'university' in combined_text: academic_indicators.append('university') if 'journal' in combined_text: academic_indicators.append('journal') if 'cited' in combined_text: academic_indicators.append('cited') if 'references' in combined_text: academic_indicators.append('references') if academic_indicators or 'lucas alamán' in combined_text: print(f' 🎓 ACADEMIC INDICATORS: {", ".join(academic_indicators)}') # Look for citations or references to specific works - SIMPLIFIED APPROACH import re # Use simpler patterns to avoid quote escaping issues simple_citation_patterns = [ r'"([^"]+rural[^"]+)"', # Anything with 'rural' in quotes r'"([^"]+agricult[^"]+)"', # Anything with 'agricult' in quotes r'"([^"]+countryside[^"]+)"', # Anything with 'countryside' in quotes r'"([^"]+hacienda[^"]+)"' # Anything with 'hacienda' in quotes ] citation_titles = [] for pattern in simple_citation_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, snippet, re.IGNORECASE) citation_titles.extend(matches) if citation_titles: print(f' 📝 CITATIONS FOUND: {citation_titles}') for citation in citation_titles: search_results['potential_titles'].append({ 'title': citation, 'source_url': url, 'source_title': title, 'context_snippet': snippet[:300], 'relevance_indicators': academic_indicators, 'search_query': query, 'confidence': 'high', 'source_type': 'academic_citation' }) search_results['all_findings'].append({ 'search_query': query, 'result_title': title, 'result_url': url, 'result_snippet': snippet, 'relevance_indicators': academic_indicators, 'potential_titles': citation_titles, 'strategy': 'academic_search' }) time.sleep(3) # Longer delay for academic searches except Exception as e: print(f'Error in academic search {i}: {str(e)}') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'academic_search', 'results_count': 0, 'status': f'error: {str(e)}' }) # Save comprehensive search results results_file = os.path.join('workspace', 'lucas_alaman_rural_history_search.json') with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(search_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH RESULTS ANALYSIS') print('=' * 80) total_queries = len(search_results['search_queries']) successful_queries = len([q for q in search_results['search_queries'] if q['status'] == 'success']) total_findings = len(search_results['all_findings']) total_potential_titles = len(search_results['potential_titles']) print(f'\n📊 SEARCH STATISTICS:') print(f' • Total queries executed: {total_queries}') print(f' • Successful queries: {successful_queries}') print(f' • Total findings collected: {total_findings}') print(f' • Potential titles identified: {total_potential_titles}') print(f'\n🔍 SEARCH RESULTS SAVED TO: {results_file}') if search_results['potential_titles']: print(f'\n📚 POTENTIAL ARTICLE TITLES FOUND:') print('=' * 50) # Group by confidence level high_confidence = [t for t in search_results['potential_titles'] if t['confidence'] == 'high'] medium_confidence = [t for t in search_results['potential_titles'] if t['confidence'] == 'medium'] if high_confidence: print(f'\n🎯 HIGH CONFIDENCE TITLES ({len(high_confidence)}):') for i, title_info in enumerate(high_confidence, 1): print(f'\n{i}. "{title_info["title"]}"') print(f' Source: {title_info["source_title"]}') print(f' URL: {title_info["source_url"]}') print(f' Type: {title_info.get("source_type", "general")}') print(f' Context: {title_info["context_snippet"][:150]}...') if medium_confidence: print(f'\n📋 MEDIUM CONFIDENCE TITLES ({len(medium_confidence)}):') for i, title_info in enumerate(medium_confidence, 1): print(f'\n{i}. "{title_info["title"]}"') print(f' Source: {title_info["source_title"]}') print(f' Context: {title_info["context_snippet"][:100]}...') # Create summary of most promising titles print(f'\n🏆 MOST PROMISING CANDIDATES:') print('=' * 40) # Prioritize academic sources and high confidence academic_titles = [t for t in search_results['potential_titles'] if t.get('source_type') == 'academic_citation'] bibliography_titles = [t for t in search_results['potential_titles'] if t.get('source_type') == 'bibliography'] if academic_titles: print('\n📖 From Academic Citations:') for title_info in academic_titles[:3]: # Top 3 print(f' • "{title_info["title"]}"') if bibliography_titles: print('\n📚 From Bibliographies:') for title_info in bibliography_titles[:3]: # Top 3 print(f' • "{title_info["title"]}"') # Final analysis summary search_results['analysis_summary'] = { 'total_queries': total_queries, 'successful_queries': successful_queries, 'total_findings': total_findings, 'potential_titles_count': total_potential_titles, 'high_confidence_titles': len(high_confidence), 'medium_confidence_titles': len(medium_confidence), 'academic_source_titles': len(academic_titles), 'bibliography_source_titles': len(bibliography_titles), 'search_strategies_used': ['direct_rural_search', 'bibliography_search', 'academic_search'] } else: print('\n❌ NO POTENTIAL TITLES IDENTIFIED') print('This suggests either:') print('1. The specific rural history article title is very obscure') print('2. It may be part of a larger work rather than standalone') print('3. Different search terms or approaches may be needed') print('4. The work may be known by a different description') # Save updated results with analysis with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(search_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n💾 UPDATED RESULTS SAVED TO: {results_file}') print('\n🎯 NEXT STEPS:') print('1. Review all potential titles for the most specific rural history focus') print('2. Cross-reference findings with known Lucas Alamán bibliographies') print('3. Investigate high-confidence academic citations') print('4. Consider searching for the work in Spanish if needed') print('\n=== LUCAS ALAMÁN RURAL HISTORY ARTICLE SEARCH COMPLETED ===')
Execution Output

Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 4)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json import time from ddgs import DDGS print('=== SEARCHING FOR LUCAS ALAMÁN MEXICAN RURAL HISTORY ARTICLE TITLE ===\n') print('Objective: Find the specific title of Lucas Alamán\'s article about Mexican rural history') print('Context: Lucas Alamán was confirmed as the historian with both conservative modernization biographies and Mexican rural history works\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Initialize search results storage search_results = { 'timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'objective': 'Find specific title of Lucas Alamán article on Mexican rural history', 'historian_confirmed': 'Lucas Alamán', 'search_queries': [], 'all_findings': [], 'potential_titles': [], 'analysis_summary': {} } print('TARGET CHARACTERISTICS:') print('• Author: Lucas Alamán') print('• Topic: Mexican rural history (not general Mexican history)') print('• Format: Article (not full book like Historia de México)') print('• Focus: Specifically rural/agricultural aspects of Mexican history\n') # Search Strategy 1: Direct search for Lucas Alamán rural history articles print('=== SEARCH STRATEGY 1: LUCAS ALAMÁN RURAL HISTORY ARTICLES ===') print('=' * 70) queries_strategy1 = [ 'Lucas Alamán Mexican rural history article title', '"Lucas Alamán" rural Mexico agriculture history article', 'Lucas Alamán countryside Mexican history work title', '"Lucas Alamán" rural agricultural Mexico historical article' ] searcher = DDGS(timeout=15) for i, query in enumerate(queries_strategy1, 1): print(f'\nSearch {i}: {query}') try: results = searcher.text( query, max_results=10, page=1, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "bing", "yandex"], safesearch="off", region="en-us" ) if results == []: print(f'No results found for: {query}') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'direct_rural_search', 'results_count': 0, 'status': 'no_results' }) else: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'direct_rural_search', 'results_count': len(results), 'status': 'success' }) # Analyze each result for relevant titles for j, result in enumerate(results, 1): title = result.get('title', '') url = result.get('href', '') snippet = result.get('body', '') print(f'\n Result {j}:') print(f' Title: {title}') print(f' URL: {url}') print(f' Snippet: {snippet[:200]}...' if len(snippet) > 200 else f' Snippet: {snippet}') # Check for relevance indicators combined_text = f'{title} {snippet}'.lower() relevance_indicators = [] # Key terms for rural history rural_terms = ['rural', 'countryside', 'agricultural', 'farming', 'hacienda', 'land', 'peasant'] alamán_terms = ['lucas alamán', 'alamán'] article_terms = ['article', 'essay', 'work', 'study', 'paper'] for term in rural_terms: if term in combined_text: relevance_indicators.append(f'rural:{term}') for term in alamán_terms: if term in combined_text: relevance_indicators.append(f'author:{term}') for term in article_terms: if term in combined_text: relevance_indicators.append(f'format:{term}') if relevance_indicators: print(f' ⭐ RELEVANCE INDICATORS: {", ".join(relevance_indicators)}') # Look for potential article titles in quotes or italics import re title_patterns = [ r'"([^"]*rural[^"]*?)"', r'"([^"]*countryside[^"]*?)"', r'"([^"]*agricultural[^"]*?)"', r'titled "([^"]+)"', r'article "([^"]+)"', r'work "([^"]+)"' ] potential_titles_found = [] for pattern in title_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, combined_text, re.IGNORECASE) potential_titles_found.extend(matches) if potential_titles_found: print(f' 📚 POTENTIAL TITLES FOUND: {potential_titles_found}') for title_candidate in potential_titles_found: search_results['potential_titles'].append({ 'title': title_candidate, 'source_url': url, 'source_title': title, 'context_snippet': snippet[:300], 'relevance_indicators': relevance_indicators, 'search_query': query, 'confidence': 'medium' }) # Store all relevant findings search_results['all_findings'].append({ 'search_query': query, 'result_title': title, 'result_url': url, 'result_snippet': snippet, 'relevance_indicators': relevance_indicators, 'potential_titles': potential_titles_found, 'strategy': 'direct_rural_search' }) else: print(f' No relevant indicators found') time.sleep(2) # Rate limiting except Exception as e: print(f'Error in search {i}: {str(e)}') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'direct_rural_search', 'results_count': 0, 'status': f'error: {str(e)}' }) print('\n' + '=' * 70) print('SEARCH STRATEGY 2: LUCAS ALAMÁN BIBLIOGRAPHY AND WORKS') print('=' * 70) # Search Strategy 2: Look for comprehensive bibliographies of Lucas Alamán queries_strategy2 = [ '"Lucas Alamán" bibliography complete works list', 'Lucas Alamán articles essays rural Mexico bibliography', '"Lucas Alamán" historical works rural agricultural writings', 'Lucas Alamán obra completa rural historia Mexico' ] for i, query in enumerate(queries_strategy2, 1): print(f'\nBibliography Search {i}: {query}') try: results = searcher.text( query, max_results=8, page=1, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "bing"], safesearch="off", region="en-us" ) if results == []: print(f'No results found for: {query}') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'bibliography_search', 'results_count': 0, 'status': 'no_results' }) else: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'bibliography_search', 'results_count': len(results), 'status': 'success' }) # Look for bibliographic information for j, result in enumerate(results, 1): title = result.get('title', '') url = result.get('href', '') snippet = result.get('body', '') print(f'\n Bibliography Result {j}:') print(f' Title: {title}') print(f' URL: {url}') print(f' Snippet: {snippet[:250]}...' if len(snippet) > 250 else f' Snippet: {snippet}') # Look for lists of works or bibliographic entries combined_text = f'{title} {snippet}'.lower() bibliography_indicators = [] if 'bibliography' in combined_text: bibliography_indicators.append('bibliography') if 'works' in combined_text: bibliography_indicators.append('works') if 'writings' in combined_text: bibliography_indicators.append('writings') if 'articles' in combined_text: bibliography_indicators.append('articles') if 'essays' in combined_text: bibliography_indicators.append('essays') if 'rural' in combined_text: bibliography_indicators.append('rural') if bibliography_indicators: print(f' 📖 BIBLIOGRAPHY INDICATORS: {", ".join(bibliography_indicators)}') # Look for specific work titles mentioned import re work_patterns = [ r'"([^"]*[Rr]ural[^"]*?)"', r'"([^"]*[Aa]gricult[^"]*?)"', r'"([^"]*[Cc]ountryside[^"]*?)"', r'"([^"]*[Hh]acienda[^"]*?)"', r'[Tt]itled[:\s]+"([^"]+)"', r'[Aa]rticle[:\s]+"([^"]+)"' ] bibliography_titles = [] for pattern in work_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, snippet, re.IGNORECASE) bibliography_titles.extend(matches) if bibliography_titles: print(f' 📚 WORKS MENTIONED: {bibliography_titles}') for work_title in bibliography_titles: search_results['potential_titles'].append({ 'title': work_title, 'source_url': url, 'source_title': title, 'context_snippet': snippet[:300], 'relevance_indicators': bibliography_indicators, 'search_query': query, 'confidence': 'high', 'source_type': 'bibliography' }) search_results['all_findings'].append({ 'search_query': query, 'result_title': title, 'result_url': url, 'result_snippet': snippet, 'relevance_indicators': bibliography_indicators, 'potential_titles': bibliography_titles, 'strategy': 'bibliography_search' }) time.sleep(2) # Rate limiting except Exception as e: print(f'Error in bibliography search {i}: {str(e)}') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'bibliography_search', 'results_count': 0, 'status': f'error: {str(e)}' }) print('\n' + '=' * 70) print('SEARCH STRATEGY 3: ACADEMIC SOURCES AND CITATIONS') print('=' * 70) # Search Strategy 3: Look in academic sources that might cite his rural history work queries_strategy3 = [ 'Lucas Alamán rural history cited academic sources', '"Lucas Alamán" Mexican agricultural history scholarly articles', 'Lucas Alamán hacienda system historical analysis', 'site:jstor.org "Lucas Alamán" rural Mexico' ] for i, query in enumerate(queries_strategy3, 1): print(f'\nAcademic Search {i}: {query}') try: results = searcher.text( query, max_results=6, page=1, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "bing"], safesearch="off", region="en-us" ) if results == []: print(f'No results found for: {query}') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'academic_search', 'results_count': 0, 'status': 'no_results' }) else: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'academic_search', 'results_count': len(results), 'status': 'success' }) # Analyze academic sources for j, result in enumerate(results, 1): title = result.get('title', '') url = result.get('href', '') snippet = result.get('body', '') print(f'\n Academic Result {j}:') print(f' Title: {title}') print(f' URL: {url}') print(f' Snippet: {snippet[:250]}...' if len(snippet) > 250 else f' Snippet: {snippet}') # Check for academic credibility indicators combined_text = f'{title} {snippet}'.lower() academic_indicators = [] if 'jstor' in url.lower(): academic_indicators.append('jstor') if 'academia.edu' in url.lower(): academic_indicators.append('academia') if 'university' in combined_text: academic_indicators.append('university') if 'journal' in combined_text: academic_indicators.append('journal') if 'cited' in combined_text: academic_indicators.append('cited') if 'references' in combined_text: academic_indicators.append('references') if academic_indicators or 'lucas alamán' in combined_text: print(f' 🎓 ACADEMIC INDICATORS: {", ".join(academic_indicators)}') # Look for citations or references to specific works - simplified approach import re # Use simpler patterns to avoid quote escaping issues simple_citation_patterns = [ r'"([^"]+rural[^"]+)"', # Anything with 'rural' in quotes r'"([^"]+agricult[^"]+)"', # Anything with 'agricult' in quotes r'"([^"]+countryside[^"]+)"', # Anything with 'countryside' in quotes r'"([^"]+hacienda[^"]+)"' # Anything with 'hacienda' in quotes ] citation_titles = [] for pattern in simple_citation_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, snippet, re.IGNORECASE) citation_titles.extend(matches) if citation_titles: print(f' 📝 CITATIONS FOUND: {citation_titles}') for citation in citation_titles: search_results['potential_titles'].append({ 'title': citation, 'source_url': url, 'source_title': title, 'context_snippet': snippet[:300], 'relevance_indicators': academic_indicators, 'search_query': query, 'confidence': 'high', 'source_type': 'academic_citation' }) search_results['all_findings'].append({ 'search_query': query, 'result_title': title, 'result_url': url, 'result_snippet': snippet, 'relevance_indicators': academic_indicators, 'potential_titles': citation_titles, 'strategy': 'academic_search' }) time.sleep(3) # Longer delay for academic searches except Exception as e: print(f'Error in academic search {i}: {str(e)}') search_results['search_queries'].append({ 'query': query, 'strategy': 'academic_search', 'results_count': 0, 'status': f'error: {str(e)}' }) # Save comprehensive search results results_file = os.path.join('workspace', 'lucas_alaman_rural_history_search.json') with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(search_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH RESULTS ANALYSIS') print('=' * 80) total_queries = len(search_results['search_queries']) successful_queries = len([q for q in search_results['search_queries'] if q['status'] == 'success']) total_findings = len(search_results['all_findings']) total_potential_titles = len(search_results['potential_titles']) print(f'\n📊 SEARCH STATISTICS:') print(f' • Total queries executed: {total_queries}') print(f' • Successful queries: {successful_queries}') print(f' • Total findings collected: {total_findings}') print(f' • Potential titles identified: {total_potential_titles}') print(f'\n🔍 SEARCH RESULTS SAVED TO: {results_file}') if search_results['potential_titles']: print(f'\n📚 POTENTIAL ARTICLE TITLES FOUND:') print('=' * 50) # Group by confidence level high_confidence = [t for t in search_results['potential_titles'] if t['confidence'] == 'high'] medium_confidence = [t for t in search_results['potential_titles'] if t['confidence'] == 'medium'] if high_confidence: print(f'\n🎯 HIGH CONFIDENCE TITLES ({len(high_confidence)}):') for i, title_info in enumerate(high_confidence, 1): print(f'\n{i}. "{title_info["title"]}"') print(f' Source: {title_info["source_title"]}') print(f' URL: {title_info["source_url"]}') print(f' Type: {title_info.get("source_type", "general")}') print(f' Context: {title_info["context_snippet"][:150]}...') if medium_confidence: print(f'\n📋 MEDIUM CONFIDENCE TITLES ({len(medium_confidence)}):') for i, title_info in enumerate(medium_confidence, 1): print(f'\n{i}. "{title_info["title"]}"') print(f' Source: {title_info["source_title"]}') print(f' Context: {title_info["context_snippet"][:100]}...') # Create summary of most promising titles print(f'\n🏆 MOST PROMISING CANDIDATES:') print('=' * 40) # Prioritize academic sources and high confidence academic_titles = [t for t in search_results['potential_titles'] if t.get('source_type') == 'academic_citation'] bibliography_titles = [t for t in search_results['potential_titles'] if t.get('source_type') == 'bibliography'] if academic_titles: print('\n📖 From Academic Citations:') for title_info in academic_titles[:3]: # Top 3 print(f' • "{title_info["title"]}"') if bibliography_titles: print('\n📚 From Bibliographies:') for title_info in bibliography_titles[:3]: # Top 3 print(f' • "{title_info["title"]}"') # Final analysis summary search_results['analysis_summary'] = { 'total_queries': total_queries, 'successful_queries': successful_queries, 'total_findings': total_findings, 'potential_titles_count': total_potential_titles, 'high_confidence_titles': len(high_confidence), 'medium_confidence_titles': len(medium_confidence), 'academic_source_titles': len(academic_titles), 'bibliography_source_titles': len(bibliography_titles), 'search_strategies_used': ['direct_rural_search', 'bibliography_search', 'academic_search'] } else: print('\n❌ NO POTENTIAL TITLES IDENTIFIED') print('This suggests either:') print('1. The specific rural history article title is very obscure') print('2. It may be part of a larger work rather than standalone') print('3. Different search terms or approaches may be needed') print('4. The work may be known by a different description') # Save updated results with analysis with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(search_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n💾 UPDATED RESULTS SAVED TO: {results_file}') print('\n🎯 NEXT STEPS:') print('1. Review all potential titles for the most specific rural history focus') print('2. Cross-reference findings with known Lucas Alamán bibliographies') print('3. Investigate high-confidence academic citations') print('4. Consider searching for the work in Spanish if needed') print('\n=== LUCAS ALAMÁN RURAL HISTORY ARTICLE SEARCH COMPLETED ===')
Execution Output
Code Output: === SEARCHING FOR LUCAS ALAMÁN MEXICAN RURAL HISTORY ARTICLE TITLE === Objective: Find the specific title of Lucas Alamán's article about Mexican rural history Context: Lucas Alamán was confirmed as the historian with both conservative modernization biographies and Mexican rural history works TARGET CHARACTERISTICS: • Author: Lucas Alamán • Topic: Mexican rural history (not general Mexican history) • Format: Article (not full book like Historia de México) • Focus: Specifically rural/agricultural aspects of Mexican history === SEARCH STRATEGY 1: LUCAS ALAMÁN RURAL HISTORY ARTICLES === ====================================================================== Search 1: Lucas Alamán Mexican rural history article title Found 10 results Result 1: Title: Lucas Alamán - Wikipedia URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lucas_Alamán Snippet: Lucas Ygnacio José Joaquín Pedro de Alcántar Juan Bautista Francisco de Paula de Alamán y Escalada was a Mexican scientist, conservative statesman, historian , and writer.
